newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh port users threaten strike.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh port users threaten strike.

text.p: Bangladeshi port users on Saturday threatened to boycott the country's main Chittagong port indefinitely from June 15 unless the government allows them to operate their own equipment.
"The boycott for an indefinite period will begin at 7 a.m on June 15 if the government fails to meet our demand," Kamaluddin Ahmed, Convenor of the Port Users Forum (PUF), told a news conference.
"We have been waiting for the last four months for a firm government decision on this issue," he said.

The PUF is a body of stevedores, clearing and forwarding agents and shipping agencies. They want to use their own equipment in jetties and container yards for loading and unloading, which the government earlier agreed in principle to allow.
But the decision was held back in the wake of protests by the port labour union.
Eighty percent of the country's exports and imports are handled by Chittagong port.
